instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Board not powering on with power button, but from keyboard connector all signals coming through. Powering on when without battery and then works normal.Keyboard needs replacement?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Monitor <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> signal, w/ and w/o KB connected.
Do yo note 3-0-3V drop pulse when use power pads, or button?
